text.author: Wikinews
text.title: Wikinews interviews Robert Sarvis, Libertarian Party nominee for Governor of Virginia
text.summary1: (human1) In an interview with Wikinews, Attorney Robert Sarvis , the Libertarian Party's nominee for Governor of Virginia in 2013, answers questions about his candidacy, including regarding his background as a mixed-race half-Chinese Virginian, his criticism of Governor Bob McDonnell, problems with the two party system, and how he would handle a hostile legislature.
text.summary2: (human2) In an email interview, Attorney Robert Sarvis, the Libertarian Partyâ€™s nominee for Governor of Virginia in 2013, discusses his mixed-race heritage; background in economics, law, and technology; critiques of governor Bob McDonnell; his success in polls due to voter frustration with the two-party system; and how he will work with the legislature as a third party governor.
text.summary3: (human3) Robert Sarvis, the 2013 libertarian candidate for the Governor of Virginia, emphasizes his Virginia ties, personal sincerity, and professional credentials to provide an alternative to the two-party system and increase collaboration between different political parties, a goal he claims Thomas Jefferson would have sought.
text.summary4: (human4) Robert Sarvis, in an emailed interview, emphasizes his unique qualifications as a mixed-race, Virginia-born candidate with a background in economics, law, and technology, advocating for economic freedom, personal liberty, and principled opposition to cronyism and corporatism in his gubernatorial campaign.
text.summary5: (human5) In an interview conducted by Wikinews reporter William Saturn, Robert Sarvis, the Libertarian candidate for the 2013 Virginia gubernatorial election, explains his strengths as a candidate, while critiquing the previous governorship of Bob McDonnell.
